text: For the purposes of this chapter, the term:
historical:
Legislative History of Laws

Law 17-10, the "Human Papillomavirus Vaccination and Reporting Act of 2007", was introduced in Council and assigned Bill No. 17-30 which was referred to the Committee on Health. The Bill was adopted on first and second readings on April 3, 2007, and April 19, 2007, respectively. Signed by the Mayor on May 4, 2007, it was assigned Act No. 17-39 and transmitted to both Houses of Congress for its review. D.C. Law 17-10 became effective on July 12, 2007.

DC CODE ยง 7-1651.01

Current through December 11, 2012

sections.text: "CDC" means the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention.

title.text: Human Health Care and Safety. (Refs & Annos)
